page.title: 10BARLBOROUGH CHURCH
page.content: The church in the village is called {St.James}church.The entry in the {Domesday Book}links Barlborough with Whitwell and states that one Priest served both villages. It is evident that there was a church in Barlborough in early{Norman times and it is most probable that this was a{Saxon building}replaced when the church was rebuilt by the Normans in the latter half of the{12th century. Of this Norman building the only part left is the very fine Norman arcade built about 1170.The remains of an oak beam which probably at some time supported a Rood screen, can be seen. The lower part of the tower and the chancel arch are both early English, probably built about 1280-1290,while the Tower Arch is a very good example of a five pointed gothic arch. Restoration in the 18th century
